author: NewsBreak Original
title: Masters of the Air Video Previews Tom Hanks & Steven Spielberg‚Äôs WWII Drama
text: Apple TV+ has dropped a new Masters of the Air video for the upcoming historical drama, which chronicles the bravery and struggles of a group of Air Force soldiers during World War II. The featurette provides a preview of the show‚Äôs epic scale and scope. It features commentary from the main cast and creative team, including executive producers Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg , as they discussed what is the show about. This marks Hanks and Austin Butler‚Äôs latest collaboration following 2022‚Äôs Elvis. The series will start streaming January 26. Check out the Masters of the Air video below ( watch more trailers ): ‚ÄúIt follows the men of the 100th Bomb Group (the ‚ÄòBloody Hundredth‚Äô) as they conduct perilous bombing raids over Nazi Germany and grapple with the frigid conditions, lack of oxygen, and sheer terror of combat conducted at 25,000 feet in the air,‚Äù reveals the synopsis. ‚ÄúPortraying the psychological and emotional price paid by these young men as they helped destroy the horror of Hitler‚Äôs Third Reich is at the heart of Masters of the Air. Some were shot down and captured; some were wounded or killed. And some were lucky enough to make it home. Regardless of individual fate, a toll was exacted on them all. Ranging in location from the bucolic fields and villages of southeast England, to the harsh deprivations of a German prisoner-of-war camp, and depicting a unique and crucial time in world history, Masters of the Air is enormous in both scale and scope, and a genuine cinematic achievement.‚Äù Based on Donald L. Miller‚Äôs 2007 book of the same name, Masters of the Air depicts the heroic actions of the men of the 100th Bombardment Group of the United States Army Air Forces during World War II. The ensemble cast includes Austin Butler as Major Gale Cleven, Barry Keoghan as Lt. Curtis Biddick, Callum Turner as Major John Egan, Anthony Boyle as Major Harry Crosby, Nate Mann as Major Robert Rosenthal, Raff Law as Sgt. Ken Lemmons, and more. The series is executive produced and directed by Cary Joji Fukunaga from a screenplay adapted by John Orloff, who is also producing. Executive producers are Tom Hanks, Gary Goetzman, Grahan Yost, Steven Spielberg, Darryl Frank, Justin Falvey, and Steven Shareshian, with Dee Rees, Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck serving as directors. The post Masters of the Air Video Previews Tom Hanks & Steven Spielberg‚Äôs WWII Drama appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More .

author: Ankita Deshkar
title: Your photos aren't safe: How deepfake tech is being weaponised, and how to fight back
text:
In this week‚Äôs The Safe Side, we explore the rise of deepfake technology, its dangers, and the avenues available to victims to protect themselves against the violation of their privacy. Written by Ankita Deshkar Nagpur | Updated: January 10, 2025 15:02 IST 8 min read The growing threat of deepfake pornography. (Image: Abhishek Mitra/The Indian Express) The misuse of artificial intelligence continues to challenge ethical and legal boundaries, with one of its most alarming manifestations being deepfake pornography. To counter this growing threat, the US Senate recently passed the bipartisan ‚ÄòTake It Down‚Äô Act, which criminalises the publication of non-consensual intimate imagery, including AI-generated deepfake content. The Bill, which mandates social media platforms and websites to remove such content within 48 hours of notification from victims, now moves to the House for consideration.
It is important to understand the technology behind deepfake pornography, its rise, dangers, how individuals can protect themselves, and what to do if photos or videos are being misused.
To get insights about the issue, we spoke with Abhivardhan, chairperson and managing trustee, Indian Society of Artificial Intelligence and Law, and Lohit Matani, Nagpur‚Äôs deputy commissioner of police (cyber).
Advertisement The growing threat of deepfake pornography In 2024, deepfakes took centre stage in India following morphed images of Bollywood celebrities Rashmika Mandanna, Alia Bhatt , and Katrina Kaif spread like wildfire on social media. However, deepfakes are not limited to celebrities, the technology has been used increasingly to target regular people, making deepfake pornography a widespread concern.
According to social media analytics firm Twicsy, 84 per cent of social media influencers have fallen victim to deepfake pornography. What began with hyper-realistic AI-generated celebrity images has now transitioned into scams and blackmail targeting ordinary people.
Also Read | Love, lies, and loss: How scammers on dating apps lure lonely hearts Take the case of Sanket (name changed). Early last year, he clicked on a seemingly harmless advertisement on a social media platform. What followed was a nightmare‚Äîscammers with access to his public pictures began blackmailing him with deepfake intimate images, threatening to distribute them unless he paid up.
(Illustration: Abhishek Mitra/The Indian Express) Sanket initially ignored the threats, turning off his phone to avoid incessant WhatsApp calls. But the harassment escalated when fake Facebook profiles began sharing doctored images of him in the comments section of his posts. He deleted his Facebook profile and changed his number. Fearing judgment and distrust from law enforcement, Sanket chose not to report the incident to the cybercrime cell. ‚ÄúThey would have found faults in my social media usage, would have judged me for clicking on an inappropriate advertisement, and I believe nothing would have changed,‚Äù he told indianexpress.com .
Advertisement With better awareness, Sanket could have averted the emotional and social toll of such a traumatic experience.
How are deepfakes made? Creating deepfake pornography has become alarmingly easy, with more than a hundred ‚Äúnudify‚Äù websites, software and applications available online. These tools allow even users with minimal technical skills to create deepfakes. A simple search will lead users to these websites.
While ‚Äúrules‚Äù on such websites say only those above 18 years of age are allowed, there is no proof or verification required, much like on porn sites, and even though such websites warn users not to use others‚Äô images without their permission, it is obvious users are not going to use the tool to create their own pornographic images.
According to Abhivardhan, cases of deepfakes in India have grown at an alarming pace‚Äînot just in political campaigns but also in non-political contexts. ‚ÄúAccording to a report, deepfake online content increased by 900 per cent between 2019 and 2020 globally, and some researchers predict that up to 90 per cent of online content could be made synthetically by 2026. More recent analysis shows that Indian social media users are frequently exposed to AI-altered media,‚Äù he said.
Advertisement (Illustration: Abhishek Mitra/ The Indian Express ) Modern AI deepfakes are powered by Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), which uses two machine-learning models: a ‚Äúgenerator‚Äù to create synthetic media and a ‚Äúdiscriminator‚Äù to detect if it‚Äôs fake. Through repeated attempts, the generator refines its output until the visual or audio content is convincingly realistic. The continuous feedback loop between the generator and discriminator polishes the output until it is often indistinguishable from genuine footage, rendering it highly deceptive making these deepfakes very convincing. Advanced AI can capture minute details‚Äîfacial expressions, lighting nuances, voice tones, and more.
India‚Äôs legal framework for deepfakes ‚ÄúAt present, India lacks a comprehensive legal framework specifically tailored to AI-generated content or deepfakes. AI platforms generally operate in a grey area‚Äîso long as they adhere to India‚Äôs Information Technology (IT) Act, 2000, and avoid hosting or distributing explicit illegal content, they may remain technically within legal limits. However, the law is still evolving,‚Äù Abhivardhan said.
While the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) 2023 includes provisions for defamation, fraud, identity theft, deepfakes or non-consensual AI-generated images and videos are not explicitly addressed. Same is the case with the IT Act, 2000.
Recent advisories from the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology have faced criticism for being vague and non-binding. Civil remedies under privacy and defamation laws also remain limited in scope.
What should victims do? Preserve evidence: Capture screenshots, note URLs and timestamps of the manipulated content.
Advertisement Report to authorities: Capture screenshots, note URLs and timestamps of the manipulated content. File a complaint with the cybercrime cell via the Ministry of Home Affairs portal or local police station. Sections 66E (image privacy) of the IT Act or provisions of the BNS can be invoked.
Request platform takedowns: Most social media platforms have policies against non-consensual intimate images or manipulated content. Victims can file a takedown request with evidence.
Seek legal help: A legal notice or cease-and-desist letter might be needed if the perpetrator or platform is unresponsive.
NGOs and legal aid programmes: While India does not have a specific deepfake support organisation, certain digital rights groups, cyber law clinics, and pro bono legal initiatives may help navigate the process.
Advertisement Also Read | You are one click away from losing everything: The real danger of KYC scams According to Matani, ‚ÄúThe primary motive when a victim files a complaint regarding morphed intimate images is to take down the image from the platform where it has been uploaded or shared. The steps are to identify the account, deleting the media and identifying and nabbing the accused.‚Äù
In cases involving sharing of such manipulated data on WhatsApp, ‚Äúit becomes important to delete the images from the devices of the people‚Äù, said Matani. ‚ÄúIf the pictures are shared on WhatsApp groups, the admins are treated as accused in the case.
The accused are booked under the combination of sections from Information Technology Act, 2000 and the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita, 2023. In cases of child pornography, the accused are booked under relevant sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO),‚Äù he said.
Preventive measures Abhivardhan listed some preventive measures for social media users:
Advertisement üìåRestrict privacy settings: Limit who can view or download your content.
üìåAvoid sharing sensitive data: Remove geotags, personal identifiers, or any data that can be used to create convincing forgeries.
üìåTwo-factor authentication: Enable it to reduce account hacking risks.
üìåUse watermarking: Subtle watermarking of personal images can deter misuse. This may not be foolproof, it adds a barrier.
üìåBe vigilant: Regularly review tagged photos or unknown friend requests to catch unauthorised usage
Advertisement The way forward Deepfake technology poses unique challenges to privacy and security. Beyond its misuse in pornography, it enables sophisticated fraud, such as voice cloning for identity theft.
Abhivardhan underscores the shared responsibility of governments, tech platforms, and citizens to address this issue. While AI-driven innovations hold promise, their misuse must be curtailed to protect personal rights and maintain public trust in digital spaces.

title: Los mejores MEMES de la eliminaci√≥n de Messi y el Inter Miami; as√≠ se burlan las redes
text:
El Inter Miami sum√≥ la noche de este mi√©rcoles un fracaso en la Copa de Campeones de la Concacaf, al ser goleado y eliminando de la competencia.
El equipo liderado por Lionel Messi poco pudo hacer ante Vancouver Whitecaps, que con calidad y autoridad derrot√≥ por global (1-5) a las Garzas para llegar a la final.
Lee tambi√©n Hijo de Jos√© Ram√≥n Fern√°ndez lanza advertencia a TV Azteca; "Cuando se retire Luis Garc√≠a y Martinoli se acab√≥"
Con el resultado negativo, las redes sociales comenzaron a burlarse de lo ocurrido, se√±alando a Lionel Messi con MEMES, por lo poco que ayud√≥ a sus compa√±eros.
Aqu√≠ te dejamos los mejores MEMES del partido, que represent√≥ una noticia negativa para el equipo que es la cara de la MLS.

author: Michael Vulpillieres
title: Gaza: New Israeli orders force thousands in Deir al-Balah to flee again, and disrupt last aid hub
text:
RAMALLAH, August 22, 2024 ‚Äì New displacement orders issued by Israeli authorities have forced another mass movement of families and humanitarian workers from areas in Deir al-Balah ‚Äì one of the only remaining areas in the occupied Gaza Strip with essential infrastructure and warehouses storing aid supplies.
Many Palestinian families, already forcibly displaced countless times since October, are on the move yet again, including humanitarian workers critical to providing the limited aid response that is still possible.
At least 24 NGOs have reported impacts from orders in the past week resulting in the forced displacement of staff members, operations disrupted, and at least one site sheltering civilians under attack. Warehouses storing supplies are located within the blocks that have come under orders that are resulting in forcible displacement.
So-called ‚Äò‚Äúevacuation‚Äù orders issued by Israeli authorities on 13, 15, 16 and 21 August continue to obstruct aid operations, affecting a number of agencies including Save the Children, Mercy Corps, the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC), MSF, Solidarit√©s International, Medical Aid for Palestinians, Oxfam, Humanity & Inclusion, Action Against Hunger, Islamic Relief, Project HOPE, DanChurchAid and Norwegian Church Aid and partners, and Palestinian partners of ActionAid, War Child, Danish Refugee Council, M√©dicos del Mundo, Middle East Children‚Äôs Alliance and WeWorld.
A shelter belonging to ANERA has come under fire, while NRC has waited more than 15 days for the Israeli authorities to respond to a request to deconflict an area where they seek to relocate staff following Israel‚Äôs latest displacement order.
The UN said that multiple orders issued by Israeli forces in Khan Younis and Deir al-Balah between 8 and 17 August impacted 17 health facilities, including five primary healthcare centres and nine medical points, disrupting essential health services. Disruptions will also threaten the ability to administer critically needed polio vaccines once they arrive in Gaza.
Communities are cut off from vital aid, as suppliers who deliver essential items like water, face challenges reaching locations close to the areas which people have been ordered to leave.
Humanitarian actors must be allowed to deliver aid based on need rather than the designation of safe areas by a party to the conflict.
‚ÄúEven if Israeli authorities let polio vaccines in, with the biggest responders in Gaza constantly pin-balled from one place to the next, how can we deliver an effective campaign and reach the children in dire need of that protection? If you want to understand the access situation, this is it ‚Äì not the trickle of trucks exceptionally allowed to enter.‚Äù said Jeremy Stoner, Save the Children Regional Director for the Middle East.
‚ÄúPalestinians in Gaza have been relentlessly uprooted, forced from one so-called ‚Äòsafe‚Äô area to the next, enduring unimaginable hardship and loss. Among them are brave humanitarian workers who risk their lives every day to save others. Our ability to provide meaningful aid in any part of Gaza does not meet our ambitions, l let alone the overwhelming needs. Deir al-Balah, once declared a humanitarian zone, is now under attack with bombardment at our doorstep,‚Äù said Sally Abi Khalil, Oxfam‚Äôs Regional Director for the Middle East and North Africa.
‚ÄúWe are a humanitarian organisation, trying to deliver humanitarian services in what Israel had unilaterally declared a ‚Äòhumanitarian zone‚Äô. These conditions don‚Äôt just punish us, they impact civilians assistance,‚Äù said Suze van Meegen, NRC‚Äôs acting Country Director in Palestine.
‚ÄúThe situation has become incredibly dangerous. There‚Äôs constant fighting, and the sounds of shelling and explosions are clearly audible. Skin diseases are spreading rapidly. We‚Äôre all becoming paranoid that we‚Äôll get infected. The physical toll is real. I‚Äôve been having severe stomach pains, likely from the contaminated water we‚Äôre forced to drink. I don‚Äôt know how much longer we can survive like this,‚Äù said Lena*, Mercy Corps staff member in Gaza.
For more than 10 months, humanitarian organisations have called for an immediate and sustained ceasefire. Now the looming risk of a polio outbreak and urgent need to vaccinate children in Gaza makes this more urgent than ever.
All parties to conflict have an obligation to facilitate humanitarian access at all times. Israel as the occupying power is obligated to ensure that the humanitarian needs of the occupied population are met. This includes facilitating humanitarian aid and creating conditions that enable the safe provision of supplies, and has been ordered by the International Court of Justice in its provisional measures of 26 January and 24 May.
Rafah served as the main hub for Gaza‚Äôs strained aid operations until early May, when Israeli forces expanded their ground operations there. Aid agencies were forced to move their operations to Deir al-Balah. With northern Gaza decimated, southern Gaza largely inaccessible, civilians and aid workers, and critically needed humanitarian operations, now have nowhere left to go.
Signed:
1. Save the Children
2. War Child
3. ActionAid
4. DanChurchAid
5. Solidarit√©s International
6. Islamic Relief
7. Middle East Children‚Äôs Alliance
8. Danish Refugee Council
9. WeWorld
10. Humanity & Inclusion/ Handicap International (HI)
11. Norwegian People‚Äôs Aid
12. Danish Refugee Council
13. The Palestinian Association for Empowerment and Local Development ‚Äì REFORM
14. Agricultural Development Association ‚Äì PARC
15. Anera
16. M√©dicos del Mundo
17. M√©decins Sans Frontieres / Doctors Without Borders (MSF)
18. Medical Aid for Palestinians
19. Norwegian Church Aid
20. Action Against Hunger
21. ChildFund Alliance
22. Global Communities
23. Mercy Corps
24. Oxfam
25. CARE International
26. Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC)
27. American Friends Service Committee (AFSC)
Editor‚Äôs Note:
- The Israeli designated ‚Äúhumanitarian zone‚Äù now ecompasses less than 11 per cent of Gaza, according to the UN.
- Civilians who are unable or unwilling to leave their homes remain protected under international humanitarian law.

author: Isaac Horcajada
title: El minuto que cambi√≥ (moment√°neamente) la suerte de Bar√ßa y Atl√©tico: Lamine y Griezmann, al rescate | F√∫tbol | Cadena SER
text: [F√∫tbol](/deportes/futbol) El minuto que cambi√≥ (moment√°neamente) la suerte de Bar√ßa y Atl√©tico: Lamine y Griezmann, al rescate Ambos equipos iban perdiendo hasta el minuto 28 de partido FC Barcelona y Atl√©tico de Madrid debutaban este jueves en el nuevo formato de Champions League. Los blaugranas visitaban M√≥naco y los rojiblancos recib√≠an al Leipzig. Ninguno de los dos conjuntos arranc√≥ su andadura en Europa de la mejor manera posible. En el Metropolitano, el Atl√©tico sufri√≥ el buen arranque de partido de los alemanes a los cuatro minutos de encuentro. Sesko abri√≥ a banda hacia Nusa, que finaliz√≥ en el √°rea y Oblak le contest√≥ con un parad√≥n, pero el bal√≥n rechazado en el √°rea lo caz√≥ de cabeza el propio Sesko para cabecear a gol y poner por delante en el electr√≥nico al Leipzig. El comienzo del Bar√ßa fue peor. Los arranques en Liga de los de Flick estaban siendo arrolladores, dominando desde el comienzo y creando peligro con mucha facilidad, pero ante el conjunto franc√©s fue todo lo contrario. En el minuto 10 de partido, Ter Stegen fall√≥ en la salida de bal√≥n, cediendo mal el bal√≥n y regal√°ndoselo a un rival. Ante ello, Eric Garc√≠a empuj√≥ a Minamino justo al borde del √°rea para evitar el mano a mano, por lo que acab√≥ viendo la tarjeta y dejando al Bar√ßa con diez jugadores. Pocos minutos despu√©s, una gran acci√≥n individual de Akliouche serv√≠a a los locales para adelantarse en esta cita europea. El minuto de oro para el f√∫tbol espa√±ol El minuto 28 de encuentro fue un punto de inflexi√≥n para ambos conjuntos espa√±oles en sus respectivos enfrentamientos. Bal√≥n largo que gana Lamine Yamal a la carrera, lanza la diagonal hacia dentro, finalizando con un disparo ajustadito al palo corto, superando a Kohn y haciendo su primer gol en Champions. En ese mismo minuto, pero en el Metropolitano, Griezmann tambi√©n firm√≥ las tablas para los suyos. Apertura a Llorente, que centra al coraz√≥n del √°rea, y el '7' del Atl√©tico finaliza de volea sin dejarla caer con la diestra para lograr el 1-1 en el marcador. author: Jorge Eduardo Villag√≥mez Ar√©chiga
title: Aparece narcomanta en el Centro de Monterrey: 'La guerra ya empez√≥' - Reporte Indigo
text: Aparece narcomanta en el Centro de Monterrey: ‚ÄòLa guerra ya empez√≥‚Äô El mensaje, atribuido al C√°rtel del Noreste, amenaza a grupos rivales y advierte que tienen presencia en toda la Zona Metropolitana [Jorge Eduardo Villag√≥mez Ar√©chiga](https://www.reporteindigo.com/author/jorge-villagomez/) En medio de preocupantes [√≠ndices delictivos](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/homicidios-en-nuevo-leon-violencia-situacion-constante/) en Nuevo Le√≥n, y justo un d√≠a despu√©s de que [11 civiles armados fueran abatidos](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/abate-fuerza-civil-a-11-presuntos-delincuentes-en-general-teran-nl/) en el municipio de Los Ramones por elementos de Fuerza Civil, una narcomanta fue colocada en el Centro de Monterrey por presuntos integrantes del C√°rtel del Noreste, misma en la que amenazan a grupos rivales y advierten que ‚Äúla guerra ya empez√≥‚Äù. El hallazgo fue reportado en el cruce de Venustiano Carranza y Crist√≥bal Col√≥n, en el coraz√≥n de la ciudad, provocando la movilizaci√≥n inmediata de la [Polic√≠a de Monterrey](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/atacan-a-elemento-de-la-policia-de-monterrey-sale-ileso/). C√°rtel del Noreste colg√≥ narcomanta contra grupos rivales en c√©ntrico cruce de Col√≥n y Venustiano Carranza, [#Monterrey], donde amenaz√≥ que ‚Äúya empez√≥ la guerra‚Äù. Ayer CDN tuvo 12 bajas y 1 detenido en enfrentamientos con Fuerza Civil en General Ter√°n y Los Ramones, Nuevo Le√≥n.[pic.twitter.com/5wQ3eVhRgr]‚Äî Jes√∫s Rub√©n Pe√±a (@revistacodigo21) [September 26, 2024] En el texto, se amenaza a los grupos ‚ÄúLos Costales‚Äù y a la ‚ÄúGente del 01‚Äú, presuntos enemigos de la organizaci√≥n; de la misma forma, se obliga a los ‚Äúindependientes‚Äù a ‚Äúalinearse‚Äù o sufrir las consecuencias, subrayando que tienen presencia en toda la Zona Metropolitana de Monterrey. ‚ÄúOperativa La Silla CDN (Cartel del Noreste), ya estamos en el Centro y en toda el √Årea Metropolitana, vamos por ‚ÄòLos Costales‚Äô y ‚ÄòGente del 01‚Äô; independientes, al√≠niense o √°branse a la ver‚Ä¶., que ya empez√≥ la guerra‚Äú, puede leerse en el mensaje. Hasta el momento, ninguna autoridad ha realizado comentarios en torno al hallazgo. Abaten a 11 presuntos delincuentes El d√≠a de ayer, luego de un [ataque a balazos](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/atacan-a-balazos-la-comandancia-de-la-policia-de-general-teran-nl/) a la comandancia policial del municipio de General Ter√°n, elementos de Fuerza Civil, Sedena y Guardia Nacional sostuvieron un enfrentamiento con presuntos integrantes del crimen organizado, mismo en el que fueron abatidos once civiles armados. El enfrentamiento se llev√≥ a cabo durante la tarde del mi√©rcoles sobre la carretera de [General Ter√°n](https://www.reporteindigo.com/reporte/familia-de-teran-nuevo-leon-es-encontrada-con-vida-tras-ser-reportada-como-desaparecida/) y China. Trascendi√≥ que el conflicto deriv√≥ de un ataque propiciado por los presuntos delincuentes en el municipio de Los Ramones, lo que provoc√≥ una persecuci√≥n. [#IndigoMTY]| Luego del ataque a la comandancia policial del municipio de General Ter√°n,[#NuevoLe√≥n], la[@SSeguridadNL]inform√≥ que se abatieron a 11 presuntos delincuentes, adem√°s de lograr el aseguramiento de seis camionetas blindadas.[https://t.co/3eIuzS864J]‚Äî Reporte √çndigo (@Reporte_Indigo) [September 26, 2024] En el operativo se incautaron seis camionetas blindadas y un n√∫mero no especificado de armamento, mismo que fue puesto a disposici√≥n de las autoridades; adem√°s, se logr√≥ la detenci√≥n de un presunto involucrado. Aunque no existe confirmaci√≥n oficial, los civiles armados que fueron abatidos pertenec√≠an al mismo grupo criminal que se adjudic√≥ la autor√≠a de la narcomanta dejada durante la tarde de hoy en el centro de Monterrey.

author: Nelson Quiroz,Diana Copa
title: Presidente Boric lidera reuni√≥n de monitoreo por sistema frontal en centro y sur de Chile: ‚ÄúTodos debemos cuidarnos, evacuar cuando se alerte‚Äù | ADN Radio
text: Presidente Boric lidera reuni√≥n de monitoreo por sistema frontal en centro y sur de Chile: ‚ÄúTodos debemos cuidarnos, evacuar cuando se alerte‚Äù De acuerdo a estimaciones, la regi√≥n de Valpara√≠so recibir√≠a hasta 90 mil√≠metros de agua durante la jornada, mientras que en el √ëuble y el Biob√≠o car√≠an 80 mm y la Metropolitana 60 mm. Este viernes 21 de junio comenz√≥ [el sistema frontal que afectar√° a varias regiones de Chile ](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/06/19/se-viene-una-potente-corriente-de-chorro-junto-al-nuevo-sistema-frontal-que-es-y-cuales-regiones-seran-afectadas-por-la-lluvia/)por varios d√≠as, trayendo consigo fr√≠o y lluvias intensas: La temperatura m√°xima registrada es de 8 ¬∞C, la cual se mantendr√° durante todo el d√≠a. De acuerdo a estimaciones, la regi√≥n de Valpara√≠so recibir√≠a hasta 90 mil√≠metros de agua durante la jornada, mientras que en el √ëuble y el Biob√≠o car√≠ 80 mm y la Metropolitana 60 mm. Revisa tambi√©n Ante este escenario, debido a las diversas situaciones de emergencia registradas a lo largo del pa√≠s, la tarde de este viernes, el Presidente Gabriel Boric encabez√≥ una reuni√≥n de coordinaci√≥n y monitoreo en La Moneda el Presidente, junto a otras autoridades como la ministra del Interior y Seguridad P√∫blica, Carolina Toh√°; el subsecretario del Interior, Manuel Monsalve y los delegados y delegadas presidenciales de las regiones afectadas por el sistema frontal en el centro y sur del pa√≠s. ‚ÄúCompatriotas, en medio del sistema frontal que afecta la zona centro sur de nuestro pa√≠s, lo m√°s importante es proteger la vida de las personas y sus hogares. Entre todas y todos debemos cuidarnos, evacuar apenas lleguen las alertas de Senapred y seguir las indicaciones de las autoridades‚Äù, se√±al√≥ el Mandatario tras la cita v√≠a X. ‚ÄúEsta hora, hay m√°s de 90 albergues habilitados a nivel nacional, tenemos maquinaria reponiendo rutas para ir en ayuda de las personas aisladas y estamos trabajando en obras de mitigaci√≥n‚Äù, agreg√≥ el jefe de Estado. [Podcasts recomendados](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/) [Ver todos](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/)

author: archyde
title: Big change to YouTube quietly, users surprised
text:
YouTube , Google‚Äôs popular video sharing service, has quietly undergone a major overhaul.
Yes, now if you open YouTube without signing in to Google account, the home page will be completely blank .
Previously, if you opened YouTube even without logging in to an account, there were a number of videos that were recommended based on the user‚Äôs local history.
However, now if you log out of the web browser, or open YouTube on a browser without Google account login or use incognito mode, a blank page will appear when opening the video sharing website.
A message will be written on this blank page asking the user to search for videos.
It is unclear when YouTube made the change, as it was not announced by the company.
However, such a change was hinted at in August 2023, under which users were to be given the option to keep the YouTube homepage blank.
At the time it was mentioned that you had to clear your YouTube watch history to blank the homepage.
On the occasion, YouTube added that several features are connected to Watch History, including a home feed, and this new change will be better for users who prefer to search for content themselves instead of recommendations.
But then this change was not implemented as it was heavily criticized by users.
Now this new change has been made which is somewhat good or bad for the users is not yet clear.
#Big #change #YouTube #quietly #users #surprised
What are the potential impacts ‚Å§of YouTube‚Äôs blank homepage on user engagement and content discovery? **Interview with Sarah Jenkins,‚Äã Digital Media Analyst**
**Interviewer:** Thank you for joining us today, Sarah. YouTube has recently undergone a significant change, where the homepage appears‚Å£ blank to‚Å§ users who are not signed in. What do you think prompted ‚Äçthis decision?
**Sarah Jenkins:** Thanks for having me! It seems that YouTube is trying to encourage users to interact more directly with the platform ‚Äãby searching for content themselves, rather than relying on ‚Å§recommended videos. This shift could‚Å§ be seen as a move towards fostering a‚Äç more personalized experience for those who prefer to curate their own content.
**Interviewer:** That makes sense, but many users relied on those recommendations. How‚Å§ do you ‚Å¢think this will‚Äã affect user engagement on the platform?
**Sarah Jenkins:** That‚Äôs ‚Äåa crucial point. For some users, the‚Å§ absence ‚Äçof a personalized feed might lead to frustration ‚Å¢or a decline in usage, especially if‚Äå they were accustomed to discovering new content through recommendations. However, it could also attract users who are overwhelmed by recommendations‚Å£ and prefer to take control of their ‚Å£viewing experience. ‚ÄçIt‚Äôs likely that we‚Äôll ‚Å¢see varied reactions ‚Äçdepending on individual user preferences.
**Interviewer:** You‚Äå mentioned varied ‚Äãreactions. There has been criticism of this change in the past.‚Å§ Could user backlash really impact YouTube‚Äôs decision-making?
**Sarah Jenkins:** Absolutely! ‚Å§User feedback is‚Å§ vital in‚Å§ shaping platform policies. YouTube had previously hinted at implementing a ‚Äãblank homepage and faced backlash, which may have delayed such ‚Äåchanges. If users rally against this current decision, YouTube might reconsider its approach, especially if‚Äç it ‚Äçreflects negatively on user engagement metrics. Ultimately, they want to‚Äç keep their audience happy ‚Å¢and‚Å¢ active.
**Interviewer:** With this change implemented without a formal announcement, do you think transparency is an issue for YouTube?
**Sarah Jenkins:** Definitely.‚Å¢ Clear communication about significant changes is essential for retaining trust and maintaining‚Äå a ‚Äçpositive relationship with users. Users ‚Äåappreciate being informed ahead of time ‚Äçabout adjustments that directly affect their experience.‚Äç A lack of transparency ‚Å§can lead to confusion and dissatisfaction, which isn‚Äôt ‚Å§beneficial for any‚Äå platform.
**Interviewer:** Now that this change is live, what advice would‚Å§ you give to users navigating this new experience?
**Sarah Jenkins:** I would encourage users to embrace the search‚Å¢ functionality and explore channels that‚Å£ align with their interests. While the blank homepage might be disorienting at first, it can also‚Äã be an opportunity to discover‚Å§ content more intentionally. Additionally, providing feedback directly to YouTube can help them adjust their services to better meet user needs.
**Interviewer:** Lastly, how do you‚Å§ predict users will respond in the ‚Äçcoming months? Will they adapt, or is there ‚Å¢potential for greater pushback?
**Sarah Jenkins:** It‚Äôs a mixed bag. Some users will adapt and may even appreciate the change, while others might react negatively, leading to vocal complaints across social media. It will be interesting to‚Äå observe how ‚ÄãYouTube engages with ‚Äçthis feedback moving forward. Ultimately, the success‚Äå of this overhaul depends on how‚Äç well they balance user preferences with their‚Å§ strategic goals.
**Interviewer:** Thank you, Sarah, for your insights on this significant update ‚Äçfrom YouTube.
As a final thought for ‚Äåour readers, what do ‚Å§you think ‚Äçabout YouTube‚Äôs‚Å£ decision to implement a blank homepage when not signed in? Is this a step towards a better user experience, or have they taken a step too far?‚Äå We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts!

author: DHNS
title: Naidu-Reddy meeting: Well begun is half done
text:
The chief ministers of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, N Chandrababu Naidu and Revanth Reddy, have been sagacious in holding talks to end the disputes that have plagued the two states for the last 10 years. Ironically, a state formed on the basis of language had to be bifurcated under the Andhra Pradesh State Reorganisation Act, 2014. Division always creates problems, and these problems have remained unresolved for a decade. Though Naidu heads the Telugu Desam Party (TDP), which is part of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government at the Centre, and Reddy is a Congress leader, they have joined hands to address their differences at their first meeting in Hyderabad on June 6. Their meeting succeeded in creating a framework for dispute resolution. There will now be two committees: the first comprising the chief secretaries of the two states, and the second comprising the ministers concerned. If these two committees are unable to resolve an issue, it will be brought before the two chief ministers.
At the very first meeting, an agreement was reached to merge into Telangana five border villages currently with Andhra Pradesh, a task that can be accomplished only if the Centre promulgates an ordinance. There are areas in Telangana to which Andhra Pradesh has staked a claim for administrative and other reasons. Not all issues are easy to resolve. For instance, Telangana has been claiming Rs 24,000 crore as its share from the power assets held by Andhra Pradesh. Water sharing is another intractable issue that calls for deft handling by both states. Of course, this is not the first time that states have been bifurcated.
When Uttarakhand and Jharkhand were formed, and before that, when Assam was divided several times, similar disputes cropped up and they were amicably resolved. One must not forget that while there are numerous water-sharing disputes between states, often court-appointed tribunals have found workable solutions. What this underscores is that there is no problem that cannot be resolved if approached with an open mind. Today, arbitration is a well-structured branch of law which students are keen to pursue because of the immense opportunities it provides. The principles of arbitration are the same for all disputes, which need to be settled with the least inconvenience to the parties concerned.
ADVERTISEMENT Published 11 July 2024, 21:49 IST
